title: Tractor and agricultural machinery maintenance program

tasks.task: Driving a tractor to transport crops from a field
subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat of the tractor
Adjust seat for comfort and control
Engage the tractor's engine
Operate steering wheel to navigate the tractor
Use foot pedals to control speed and direction
Attach crop carrier or trailer to the rear of the tractor
Guide the trailer into the field where crops are located
Use hydraulic lift or pull pins to secure the trailer to the tractor
Drive tractor forward, moving the carrier/trailer through the field
Stop periodically to check the load and add any necessary securing measures
Remove crops from the field into the carrier/trailer
Continue transporting crops until the trailer is full
Drive tractor to the next location or to the field's edge

tasks.task: Loading the crop carrier onto a truck
subtasks: Align the carrier/trailer with the bed of the truck
Lift the tailgate or use ramps to access the truck bed
Maneuver the carrier/trailer onto the truck bed, ensuring balance and stability
Secure the carrier/trailer to the truck using straps, chains, or locks to prevent movement during transport
Close the tailgate or remove ramps once the carrier is in place

tasks.task: Unloading crops from the carrier at the farm's main location
subtasks: Position the truck carrying the crops near the designated unloading area
Operate the tailgate or ramps to allow access to the truck bed
Release any securing devices (straps/locks) on the carrier
Lift the carrier from the truck bed, possibly using a forklift or manual lifting, if necessary
Place the carrier onto designated storage or processing areas
Check the integrity of the load after unloading to ensure that all crops have been safely removed
Clean any residue or debris from the carrier/trailer before returning it to service

tasks.task: Attaching the carrier to the tractor for transport
subtasks: Position the tractor near the carrier/trailer
Lower the hydraulic lift or insert pins into the attachment points
Connect the carrier/trailer to the tractor's hitch or drawbar
Verify the connection is secure and properly locked
Check for any obstructions or loose parts that could interfere with driving
Start the tractor and conduct a test run to ensure the connection is stable and no issues arise during operation

tasks.task: Securing the load on the carrier
subtasks: Inspect the load to ensure it is stable and not at risk of shifting
Attach securing straps or chains around the crops to prevent movement
Tighten the straps with a ratchet or similar tool to ensure a secure fit
Cross-check all secured points to make sure nothing is loose
Mark any areas that need further attention or additional securing measures

tasks.task: Aligning the carrier with the truck for transport
subtasks: Ensure the carrier is correctly positioned adjacent to the truck
Make any necessary adjustments to the carrier's wheels or positioning to align with the truck bed
Extend ramps or lower tailgates if required to ease the transition
Inspect the gap between the carrier and truck to prevent damage and ensure a smooth connection
